item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Rescued Son of Ex-Pakistani Leader Returns Home From Kabul
item.description:
Rescued Son of Ex-Pakistani Leader Returns Home From Kabul

The son of a former prime minister of Pakistan returned from Afghanistan Wednesday a day after he was rescued from al-Qaida-linked kidnappers in a military operation. A special Pakistani aircraft brought Ali Haider Gilani back from Kabul and landed at the airport in the eastern city of Lahore where family members received him amid tight security.

item.title: Queen Elizabeth II: Chinese Officials Were 'Very Rude'
item.description:
Queen Elizabeth II: Chinese Officials Were 'Very Rude'

Queen Elizabeth II has been overheard on video describing Chinese officials as "very rude to the ambassador" in a conversation with a senior police officer at a Buckingham Palace event celebrating her birthday. The comments, which became public Wednesday, were unusual because the 90-year-old monarch has been careful to steer clear of politics during her long reign.

item.title: Car Bomb Explodes in Baghdad's Sadr City
item.description:
Car Bomb Explodes in Baghdad's Sadr City

A car bomb ripped through a market in a Shi'ite area of north Baghdad Wednesday, killing at least 16 people. The explosion struck the Sadr city market during the morning rush. Hospital and security officials fear the death toll may rise. At least 40 people were wounded in the attack.

item.title: Turks Tell VOA of Struggles Under Crisis
item.description:
Turks Tell VOA of Struggles Under Crisis

Turks for decades lived virtually untouched by the turmoil in the Middle East and the upheaval in the Muslim world, with the nation's internal challenge centered on curbing Kurdish insurgents. In the last two years, however, the fallout from Syria's civil war and the rise of Islamic State have caused serious problems for Turkey.
